stepTitle: The amount of sunlight in a certain city can be modeled by the function $$h=15cos\left(\frac{d}{500}\right)$$, where $$h$$ represents the hours of sunlight, and $$d$$ is the day of the year. Use the equation to find how many hours of sunlight there are on September $$24$$, the 267th day of the year. State the period of the function.
